job_description:
Job Title: System Validation Engineer Experience: 5+ Years Job Type: Contractual / Temporary Work Location: Remote Prefer Immediate Joiners

Role Purpose

Execute computer system validation (CSV) activities to ensure regulated systems are compliant, fit for intended use, and approved for production.

Compliance Scope

  • ICH E6 (GCP), FDA 21 CFR Part 11, EU Annex 11, GDPR, HIPAA, ISO 9001, ISO 27001, GAMP 5.

Core Responsibilities

  • Author and maintain Validation Plan defining scope, deliverables, testing strategy, acceptance criteria, and responsibilities.
  • Review and approve System Design Documentation (architecture, infrastructure, database, interfaces, configuration).
  • Develop Testing Plan and author/pre-approve Validation Protocols (IQ/OQ/PQ) with defined steps and expected results.
  • Execute or oversee validation testing on production or equivalent systems; document and approve results.
  • Review Code Review Reports and verify Unit Test Results for development compliance.
  • Manage Validation Incident Reports, including impact assessment, corrective actions, regression testing, and closure.
  • Maintain Traceability Matrices (URS → FRS → Design → Tests) ensuring complete coverage.
  • Prepare Testing Summary Report and Validation Summary Report authorizing production release.
  • Support Deployment Plan execution and perform Installation Qualification (IQ); ensure IQ reusability.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, IT, or equivalent.
  • Proven experience in CSV within regulated (GxP) environments.
  • Strong knowledge of SDLC, risk-based validation, and validation documentation.

Key Skills

  • Technical documentation, system architecture understanding, compliance focus, cross-functional collaboration.

Preferred Skills

  • ERP/LIMS/QMS/MES validation, electronic records/signatures, audit and inspection support.

Contact Information

Interested candidates can mail their resume to careers@appsteamtechnologies.com with the subject line "System Validation Engineer Application".
summary: System Validation Engineer needed for executing CSV activities in regulated environments. Requires 5+ years of experience with strong knowledge of GxP compliance and validation documentation.

job_description:
Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd

Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: www.reflectionsglobal.com Job Title: GIS Lead (Onshore - Qatar) Closing Date: 26, Dec 2025 Job Published: 19, Dec 2025 Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Introduction

We are seeking a highly skilled GIS Lead to own the end-to-end geospatial technology landscape for a large, mission-critical national emergency response ecosystem. The platform relies heavily on real-time geospatial processing, advanced ArcGIS capabilities, AVL (Automatic Vehicle Location), routing algorithms, incident mapping, 2D/3D visualization, spatial analytics, and complex multi-agency geodata integrations.

Responsibilities

GIS Architecture & Modernization - Define and implement the GIS modernization roadmap, including upgrades to ArcGIS Enterprise, Server, Portal, and related components. - Architect and implement 2D and 3D GIS capabilities, including building models, terrain, line-of-sight analysis, and situational visualization. - Lead the design of real-time GIS services, including streaming layers, geo-event processing, location tracking, and dynamic incident updates. - Oversee containerization or virtualization strategies for GIS components within the broader platform modernization framework.

Geospatial Data & Services Management - Own the design and optimization of geodatabases, spatial indexing, caching strategies, versioning, and partitioning. - Ensure high-quality management of base maps, operational layers, network datasets, hazard maps, cadastral data, and public infrastructure layers. - Lead the migration and transformation of existing GIS layers, widgets, and tools into the new environment.

Integration & Interoperability - Oversee all GIS integrations with emergency call-taking, dispatch, incident management, crime analytics, CCTV systems, vehicle tracking systems, mobile data terminals, and external government platforms. - Collaborate with the integration team on APIs, map services, feature services, caching services, and geoprocessing services. - Support microservices teams in consuming GIS services efficiently and securely.

Performance, Monitoring & Reliability - Define and enforce performance benchmarks for map rendering times, geoprocessing workloads, routing calculations, and data loading. - Lead the implementation of GIS monitoring tools, dashboards, and alerting mechanisms. - Work with infrastructure teams to optimize GIS performance across multiple data centers, ensuring high availability and zero-downtime operations.

GIS Development & Customization - Guide development of custom GIS widgets, map tools, dashboards, and web/mobile experiences using ArcGIS API for JS, Experience Builder, Web AppBuilder, or custom frameworks. - Review and optimize routing algorithms (Network Analyst) and AVL integrations. - Oversee implementation of spatial analytics and predictive geospatial intelligence solutions.

Stakeholder Collaboration & Leadership - Collaborate with call takers, dispatch operators, supervisors, field agents, GIS operators, and leadership to understand daily workflows and pain points. - Convert operational requirements into geospatial solutions aligned with modernization and efficiency goals. - Provide technical leadership and mentoring to GIS developers, analysts, and data engineers.

Quality Assurance & Governance - Ensure compliance with data governance, security policies, and national confidentiality standards. - Conduct GIS solution reviews, performance audits, and readiness assessments. - Define and maintain documentation, standards, and SOPs for all GIS components.

Preferred Skills

Must-Have - 8–12+ years of experience in GIS architecture, implementation, and management. - Deep expertise in Esri ArcGIS Enterprise, including: - ArcGIS Server - Portal for ArcGIS - ArcGIS Pro - ArcGIS GeoEvent / GeoAnalytics - ArcGIS Network Analyst - Strong experience with spatial databases (e.g., Enterprise Geodatabases, Oracle 19G). - Hands-on experience with real-time GIS, vehicle tracking, routing, and operational command center mapping. - Strong understanding of 2D/3D visualization, geospatial modeling, and spatial analysis tools. - Experience integrating GIS with large-scale enterprise systems. - Ability to lead technical teams and engage directly with senior business stakeholders.

Preferred - Experience in emergency response, public safety, defense, or national security systems. - Experience with containerized GIS deployments (Kubernetes / OpenShift). - Familiarity with Python (ArcPy), JavaScript (ArcGIS API for JS), and microservices-based GIS consumption. - Knowledge of Middle Eastern geography and operations is a plus. - Arabic language skills preferred.

Important Notice

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details. Please note: Reflections Info Systems does not charge any fees for job applications. All communications are conducted through official channels. For clarification, contact Careers@reflectionsinfos.com.
summary: Lead GIS architecture for a national emergency response system in Qatar, focusing on real-time geospatial processing and integration with critical systems.

The GIS Architect will design and govern the geospatial architecture for a mission-critical enterprise platform reliant on mapping, location intelligence, and real-time spatial data. Responsibilities include: - Defining ArcGIS Enterprise architecture, geodatabases, and GIS services for scalability, high availability, and security across multiple data centers and a DR site. - Modernizing legacy GIS components into a scalable, high-availability platform while collaborating with cross-functional teams. - Designing GIS services for web, desktop, mobile, and control-room applications, ensuring consistent APIs and cartographic standards. - Establishing spatial data modeling standards for routing, proximity analysis, and spatial queries. - Ensuring GIS components support active-active data centers and DR with replication strategies and failover behavior. - Optimizing GIS hosting environments (ArcGIS Enterprise + Oracle) with capacity planning and performance tuning. - Implementing GIS security best practices, including role management and integration with enterprise identity providers. - Providing technical leadership to GIS developers, analysts, and administrators.

Preferred Skills

  • Technical Skills:
  • Strong hands-on experience with ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal, Server, Data Store) in on-premises, multi-server environments.
  • Proficiency in ArcGIS Pro for geodatabase management, map authoring, and spatial analysis.
  • Deep understanding of enterprise geodatabases (ArcGIS with Oracle) for schema design and performance tuning.
  • Expertise in publishing high-volume, real-time GIS services (map, feature, geoprocessing, network analysis).
  • Integration of GIS services into web/mobile apps via REST/JavaScript APIs.
  • GIS performance optimization (caching, layer optimization, scale settings).

  • Security concepts (authentication, SSL/TLS, identity provider integration).

  • Experience and Soft Skills:

  • 8+ years in GIS solution design, with 3–4 years in an architect/lead role.
  • Proven experience in mission-critical GIS environments with strict uptime and performance requirements.
  • Multi-datacenter/DR environment experience (replication, synchronization, high-availability patterns).
  • Collaboration with application, database, infrastructure, and operations teams.
  • Excellent communication and documentation skills for technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Should Have

  • Data governance standards (lifecycle, versioning, quality checks).
  • Collaboration with analytics teams for GIS-enabled dashboards and insights.
  • Capacity planning and performance testing for high-load scenarios.
  • Incident reviews and root cause analysis for GIS issues.
  • Backup/restore strategies aligned with enterprise RPO/RTO objectives.

Technical Skills (Should Have)

  • Real-time GIS components (GeoEvent Server) for streaming data.
  • Scripting/automation (Python, ArcPy, PowerShell) for GIS administration.
  • Integration with message buses (Kafka, ActiveMQ) for real-time workflows.
  • Load balancing and clustering for GIS servers.
  • Modernization/migration projects from legacy GIS to ArcGIS Enterprise.
  • Security/compliance experience for audits.

Secondary Skills (Nice to Have)

  • Advanced GIS analytics (heatmaps, spatial clustering).
  • Open-source GIS tools (QGIS, PostGIS, GeoServer).
  • 3D GIS, indoor mapping, or advanced visualization.
  • Integration with BI tools (data warehouses, visualization platforms).

Role Overview

The Security Architect is responsible for defining and governing the security architecture for mission-critical, on-premises enterprise platforms across multiple data centers and a dedicated disaster recovery (DR) site. This role designs and reviews security controls for applications, integrations, data, infrastructure, and identities to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Collaboration with application, integration, infrastructure, network, and DevOps teams is essential to embed security into legacy system modernization (microservices, containerized workloads) while meeting regulatory, audit, and compliance requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Define security architecture and reference patterns for applications, APIs, integrations, and data flows across on-premises environments.
  • Establish security standards for identity and access management (SSO, MFA, RBAC), network security (segmentation, firewalls, VPNs), and endpoint protection.
  • Collaborate with teams to secure microservices, web apps, mobile clients, and external APIs (authentication, authorization, input validation).
  • Ensure secure configurations for servers, containers, Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters, databases, load balancers, and WAFs.
  • Define security controls for integrations with external systems (government, third-party services) and secure connectivity/data protection.
  • Oversee logging, monitoring, and alerting for security events with SIEM/SOC teams.
  • Embed secure SDLC/DevSecOps practices (threat modeling, SAST/DAST, CI/CD pipeline security).
  • Conduct architecture reviews for compliance and risk mitigation.
  • Maintain security baselines, hardening guides, and configuration benchmarks.

Preferred Technical Skills

  • Enterprise security architecture for on-prem/hybrid environments.
  • IAM technologies (Active Directory/LDAP, SSO, MFA, OAuth2, OpenID Connect, JWT).
  • Application security (OWASP Top 10, secure coding, input validation).
  • Network security (firewalls, WAFs, secure remote access).
  • Container security (Docker, Kubernetes/OpenShift, image scanning).
  • Database/data security (encryption, hardening, Oracle).
  • Security logging/monitoring (SIEM platforms, log integration).

Experience & Soft Skills

  • 10+ years in information security, with 3–4 years in a security architect role.
  • Proven experience in large-scale, mission-critical systems with uptime/compliance requirements.
  • Multi-datacenter/DR environment expertise (failover, replication, HA security).
  • Cross-functional collaboration (application, infrastructure, DevOps, network teams).
  • Excellent communication skills for technical/non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Lead threat modeling/risk assessments and translate findings into controls.
  • Define secure access policies (privileged access, just-in-time access).
  • Support incident response/forensics with logging/evidence collection.
  • Contribute to business continuity/DR planning from a security perspective.
  • Coach teams on security-by-design practices.

Technical Skills

  • CI/CD pipeline security (SAST/DAST, dependency scanning).
  • Secrets management (key/certificate storage, rotation).
  • Endpoint/server hardening (CIS benchmarks).
  • Encryption technologies (TLS, certificates).
  • Modernization projects (legacy to microservices/containerized architectures).
  • Regulatory compliance (ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI DSS).

Secondary Skills

  • Zero-trust architecture.
  • Policy-as-code (Open Policy Agent).
  • SRE/observability (SLIs/SLOs, error budgets).
  • Data classification/DLP/privacy-by-design.

Certifications

  • Security certifications (CISSP, CISM, SABSA).
  • Technical certifications (CCSP, GIAC, vendor-specific).
  • Secure software development/DevSecOps training.

Job Posting: Solution Architect (Optimizely)

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: Reflections Global Closing Date: 26, Dec 2025 Published Date: 19, Dec 2025 Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Brief Description

We are seeking 12+ years of experienced candidates for this role.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Solution Architect to lead the design and implementation of a large-scale migration from SAP B2B to Optimizely Commerce Cloud. This role will serve as the technical leader, responsible for defining a scalable, secure, and future-ready architecture. The ideal candidate has deep expertise in enterprise commerce systems, cloud architecture, and system integrations. You will guide development teams, ensure best practices in solution design, and ultimately take full ownership of the architecture and development transition from the vendor.

Responsibilities

Architecture & Design - Define end-to-end migration architecture from SAP B2B to Optimizely, including CMS, Commerce, and PIM integration. - Design scalable, secure, and high-performance frameworks aligned with business goals. - Establish data migration strategies for products, pricing, and customer hierarchies. - Ensure API integration between SAP, Optimizely, and other enterprise systems.

Technical Leadership - Lead and mentor development teams on best practices and coding standards. - Collaborate with Optimizely consultants and internal teams to validate feasibility and technical approach. - Drive DevOps strategy for CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and cloud deployment.

Project Ownership - Act as the technical owner of the migration project, taking over from vendor after initial phases. - Ensure alignment with enterprise security and compliance standards. - Provide technical guidance during feasibility analysis and pilot module migration.

Collaboration & Communication - Work closely with Business Analysts to translate requirements into technical solutions. - Communicate architecture decisions to stakeholders and leadership in business-friendly terms. - Support QA teams with test strategy for performance, integration, and security.

Preferred Skills

Primary Skills - SAP B2B Architecture: Deep understanding of SAP Commerce Cloud, Back Office, and integration patterns. - B2B Platform: Hands-on experience with CMS and Commerce Cloud platforms, specifically Optimizely. - Optimizely PIM & Spire: Strong knowledge of Optimizely Product Information Management (PIM) and Spire framework for modern commerce experiences. - .NET Development: Proficient in .NET Core and ASP.NET, essential for Optimizely development. - Cloud Architecture: Strong knowledge of Azure PaaS, commonly used for hosting Optimizely solutions. - Azure Active Directory: Experience with identity and access management using Azure AD. - API Design & Integration: Skilled in RESTful services, SAP APIs, and Optimizely endpoints. - Frontend Development: Strong React expertise with CMS integration experience.

Architectural Leadership - Modern Architecture Concepts: Experience with monolithic and microservices-based systems. - Solution Architecture Design: Ability to design scalable, secure, and maintainable frameworks. - System Integration: Expertise in bridging SAP and Optimizely platforms, including middleware and data flow strategies. - Performance & Scalability: Planning for optimized performance and future growth. - Security & Compliance: Knowledge of enterprise-grade security, data protection, and regulatory standards.

Project Ownership - End-to-End Leadership: Proven ability to lead projects from blueprint to execution. - Vendor Transition: Skilled in taking over architecture and development from external consultants. - Stakeholder Communication: Capable of translating technical decisions into business value for diverse audiences.

Secondary Skills - GraphQL & Headless CMS Architecture: Beneficial for building modern, flexible commerce experiences. - DevOps & CI/CD Pipelines: Experience with tools like Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions for automated deployments. - Containerization: Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes for scalable and efficient deployments.

Soft Skills - Team Mentoring & Coaching: Experienced in guiding developers through complex migration phases and technical transitions. - Agile Methodology: Skilled in managing sprints, backlogs, and iterative delivery cycles to ensure timely and quality outcomes. - Analytical Thinking & Problem-Solving: Strong capability in feasibility analysis, module mapping, and resolving architectural challenges. - Continuous Learning Mindset: Proactively stays updated with evolving trends in SAP BTP, Optimizely, and cloud technologies.

Application Instructions

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Fraud Alert

This is to notify jobseekers that some fraudsters are promising jobs with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. Please note that no payment is ever sought for jobs in Reflections. We contact our candidates only through our official website or LinkedIn and all employment-related mails are sent through the official HR email id. Please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com for any clarification/alerts on this subject.

  • Leadership in cross-functional teams and complex environments.
